Justification: The foramen magnum is located on the bottom of the cranium and in line with the dimension of the eye sockets. Given that a human spinal column runs perpendicular to the mandible, the placement of the foramen magnum forces bipedal movement.

The spinal column runs parallel to the ground, so the foramen magnum is placed more towards the back of the cranium and at an angle, allowing the eye sockets to face forward. Thus, the foramen magnum's location forces quadrupedal movement.
